page.title: 11NAIRN:SCHOOL TRANSPORT
page.content: Nairn Academy is a modern school of 800 pupils.The school serves other surrounding villages and towns eg. Auldearn(3miles away)Cawdor(5miles) and Ferness(9miles).Not all pupils can walk to school so many travel by school transport.eg.taxi,bus or mini- bus.These services run every day during the school year.Bicycles are also an important way of getting to school.Taxis are used by pupils who live in remote places or by pupils that are disabled.A survey showed these results: Pupils who walk to school: 56% Pupils who travel by bike: 17% Pupils who travel by taxi: 8% Pupils who travel by bus : 17% Pupils who use a mini-bus: 2% We found that that more people walk to school than any other way
